alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 7:22PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Morris, Sussex and northeastern Warren Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 722 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Dingmans Ferry to near Greendell to near Hope. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Montague, Dover, Hopatcong, Hackettstown, Wharton, Rockaway, Mount Arlington, Franklin, Mendham, Stanhope, Hamburg, Netcong, Oxford, Ogdensburg, Sussex, Hope, Chester, Victory Gardens and Branchville. This includes Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 10 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
